summary: This is a memorandum from the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) documenting a voluntary interview conducted on August 5, 2021, with a General Maintenance Worker (and Acting Facilities Manager) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The interview is part of the OIG's investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the MCC.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York is the subject of the OIG investigation. He was previously housed at MCC New York under register number 76318-054.

keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General is actively investigating the death of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York as of 2021.
The investigation involved interviewing a BOP General Maintenance Worker who also served as the Acting Facilities Manager at MCC New York during the time Epstein was housed there.
The interview was recorded and transcribed, and related documents such as an out-of-office email and a camera service request from August 2019 were collected.
The memorandum itself is an internal OIG document dated October 8, 2021, and is marked as not for distribution outside the receiving agency.
